Description: Moving the large red granite head of a colossal figure of a king in the Egyptian Gallery of the British Museum; four workmen operating a large lifting apparatus which surrounds the head. 1853 Graphite
Curator's comments: The identity of the figure of the king is not known, but recent scholars seem generally agreed that it may be Amenhotep III. The sculpture is EA 15.
Exhibition history: 1983 May-Jul, Brighton AG, 'Egypt & The British', no. 146 1983 Aug-Sep, Manchester AG, 'Egypt & The British', no. 146
